verses.verseString: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: حم
verses.verseStringB: Beneficent God!

verses.verseString: وَالْكِتَابِ الْمُبِينِ
verses.verseStringB: By the Book that makes manifest!

verses.verseString: إِنَّا أَنْزَلْنَاهُ فِي لَيْلَةٍ مُبَارَكَةٍ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا مُنْذِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: We revealed it on a blessed nighta— truly We are ever warning.

verses.verseString: فِيهَا يُفْرَقُ كُلُّ أَمْرٍ حَكِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: Therein is made clear every affair full of wisdoma—

verses.verseString: أَمْرًا مِنْ عِنْدِنَا ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا مُرْسِلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: A command from Us — truly We are ever sending messengers —

verses.verseString: رَحْمَةً مِنْ رَبِّكَ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: A mercy from thy Lord — truly He is the Hearing, the Knowing,

verses.verseString: رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُوقِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if you would be sure.

verses.verseString: لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ يُحْيِي وَيُمِيتُ ۖ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: There is no God but He; He gives life and causes death — your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of yore.

verses.verseString: بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ يَلْعَبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Nay, in doubt they sport.

verses.verseString: فَارْتَقِبْ يَوْمَ تَأْتِي السَّمَاءُ بِدُخَانٍ مُبِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: So wait for the day when the heaven brings a clear drought,ᵃ

verses.verseString: يَغْشَى النَّاسَ ۖ هَٰذَا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Enveloping men. This is a painful chastisement.

verses.verseString: رَبَّنَا اكْشِفْ عَنَّا الْعَذَابَ إِنَّا مُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Our Lord, remove from us the chastisement — surely we are believers.

verses.verseString: أَنَّىٰ لَهُمُ الذِّكْرَىٰ وَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ رَسُولٌ مُبِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: When will they be reminded? And a Messenger has indeed come, making clear;

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ تَوَلَّوْا عَنْهُ وَقَالُوا مُعَلَّمٌ مَجْنُونٌ
verses.verseStringB: Yet they turned away from him and said: One taught (by others), a madman!

verses.verseString: إِنَّا كَاشِفُو الْعَذَابِ قَلِيلًا ۚ إِنَّكُمْ عَائِدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: We shall remove the chastisement a little, (but) you will surely return (to evil).

verses.verseString: يَوْمَ نَبْطِشُ الْبَطْشَةَ الْكُبْرَىٰ إِنَّا مُنْتَقِمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: On the day when We seize (them) with the most violent seizing; surely We shall exact retribution.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَجَاءَهُمْ رَسُولٌ كَرِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We tried before them Pharaoh’s people and a noble messenger came to them,

verses.verseString: أَنْ أَدُّوا إِلَيَّ عِبَادَ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: Saying: Deliver to me the servants of Allāh.ᵃ Surely I am a faithful messenger to you.

verses.verseString: وَأَنْ لَا تَعْلُوا عَلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي آتِيكُمْ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: And exalt not yourselves against Allāh. Surely I bring to you a clear authority.

verses.verseString: وَإِنِّي عُذْتُ بِرَبِّي وَرَبِّكُمْ أَنْ تَرْجُمُونِ
verses.verseStringB: And I take refuge with my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me to death.

verses.verseString: وَإِنْ لَمْ تُؤْمِنُوا لِي فَاعْتَزِلُونِ
verses.verseStringB: And if you believe not in me, leave me alone.

verses.verseString: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُ أَنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ قَوْمٌ مُجْرِمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Then he called upon his Lord: These are a guilty people.

verses.verseString: فَأَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي لَيْلًا إِنَّكُمْ مُتَّبَعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So go forth with My servants by night; surely you will be pursued,

verses.verseString: وَاتْرُكِ الْبَحْرَ رَهْوًا ۖ إِنَّهُمْ جُنْدٌ مُغْرَقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And leave the sea behind calm.ᵃ Surely they are a host to be drowned.

verses.verseString: كَمْ تَرَكُوا مِنْ جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.verseStringB: How many of the gardens and springs they left behind!

verses.verseString: وَزُرُوعٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: And cornfields and noble places!

verses.verseString: وَنَعْمَةٍ كَانُوا فِيهَا فَاكِهِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And goodly things wherein they rejoiced!

verses.verseString: كَذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَأَوْرَثْنَاهَا قَوْمًا آخَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Thus (it was). And We made other people inherit them.

verses.verseString: فَمَا بَكَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّمَاءُ وَالْأَرْضُ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنْظَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So the heaven and the earth wept not for them, nor were they respited.ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ نَجَّيْنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ مِنَ الْعَذَابِ الْمُهِينِ
verses.verseStringB: And We indeed delivered the Children of Israel from the abasing chastisement,

verses.verseString: مِنْ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَالِيًا مِنَ الْمُسْرِفِينَ
verses.verseStringB: From Pharaoh. Surely he was haughty, prodigal.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدِ اخْتَرْنَاهُمْ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We chose them above the nations, having knowledge.

verses.verseString: وَآتَيْنَاهُمْ مِنَ الْآيَاتِ مَا فِيهِ بَلَاءٌ مُبِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: And We gave them signs wherein was clear blessing.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَيَقُولُونَ
verses.verseStringB: These do indeed say:

verses.verseString: إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا مَوْتَتُنَا الْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُنْشَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: There is naught but our first death and we shall not be raised again.

verses.verseString: فَأْتُوا بِآبَائِنَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So bring our fathers (back), if you are truthful.

verses.verseString: أَهُمْ خَيْرٌ أَمْ قَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ وَالَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ أَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا مُجْرِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Are they better or the people of Tubba‘,ᵃ and those before them? We destroyed them, for surely they were guilty.

verses.verseString: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا لَاعِبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and that which is between them in sport.

verses.verseString: مَا خَلَقْنَاهُمَا إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: We created them not but with truth, but most of them know not.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ يَوْمَ الْفَصْلِ مِيقَاتُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely the day of Decision is the term for them all,

verses.verseString: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي مَوْلًى عَنْ مَوْلًى شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: The day when friend will avail friend in naught, nor will they be helped —

verses.verseString: إِلَّا مَنْ رَحِمَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: Save those on whom Allāh has mercy. Surely He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ شَجَرَتَ الزَّقُّومِ
verses.verseStringB: Surely the tree of Zaqq∂ma

verses.verseString: طَعَامُ الْأَثِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: Is the food of the sinful,

verses.verseString: كَالْمُهْلِ يَغْلِي فِي الْبُطُونِ
verses.verseStringB: Like molten brass; it seethes in (their) bellies

verses.verseString: كَغَلْيِ الْحَمِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: Like boiling water.

verses.verseString: خُذُوهُ فَاعْتِلُوهُ إِلَىٰ سَوَاءِ الْجَحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: Seize him, then drag him into the midst of hell;

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ صُبُّوا فَوْقَ رَأْسِهِ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْحَمِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: Then pour on his head of the torment of boiling water —

verses.verseString: ذُقْ إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْعَزِيزُ الْكَرِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: Taste — thou art forsooth the mighty, the honourable!ᵃ

verses.verseString: إِنَّ هَٰذَا مَا كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَمْتَرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely this is what you doubted.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي مَقَامٍ أَمِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: Those who keep their duty are indeed in a secure place —

verses.verseString: فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.verseStringB: In gardens and springs,

verses.verseString: يَلْبَسُونَ مِنْ سُنْدُسٍ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍ مُتَقَابِلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Wearing fine and thick silk, facing one another —

verses.verseString: كَذَٰلِكَ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُمْ بِحُورٍ عِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: Thus (shall it be). And We shall join them to pure, beautiful ones.ᵃ

verses.verseString: يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِكُلِّ فَاكِهَةٍ آمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They call therein for every fruit in security —

verses.verseString: لَا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا الْمَوْتَ إِلَّا الْمَوْتَةَ الْأُولَىٰ ۖ وَوَقَاهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: They taste not therein death, except the first death; and He will save them from the chastisement of hell —

verses.verseString: فَضْلًا مِنْ رَبِّكَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْعَظِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: A grace from thy Lord. This is the great achievement.

verses.verseString: فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرْنَاهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So We have made it easy in thy tongue that they may mind.

verses.verseString: فَارْتَقِبْ إِنَّهُمْ مُرْتَقِبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Wait then; surely they (too) are waiting.

footnotes.note:
3a. The revelation of the Holy Qur’ån on a blessed night has a deeper meaningbeneath it than the mere fact that the revelation began on the blessed night which is elsewhere called lailat al-Qadr (97:1), one of the last ten nights in the month of Rama˙ån.The night stands for a time of darkness, and hence a time of ignorance, when trueknowledge had disappeared from the world. A prophet’s advent is always preceded bysuch darkness, and when the Holy Prophet made his appearance, such darkness prevailed in all countries of the world. This night is called a blessed night because in it theworld received the greatest manifestation of Divine light.

4a. Divine revelation distinguishes truth from falsehood and reveals the treasures ofwisdom to men.

10a. Dukhån means smoke, or mischief, or dearth, or drought, or hunger (LL). Thecommentators agree on the basis of highly trustworthy reports that its meaning here isdrought. According to T, dukhån means jadab, i.e., dearth or drought, and j∂‘ or famine,for (the drought brought on such misery that) the hungry man beheld smoke between himand the sky. Others, however, say the real reason why hunger is called dukhån is thatbecause of the dry earth in a drought dust rises, creating a dusty atmosphere, which islikened to smoke (LL). The chapter, as the whole tenor of it shows, belongs to the earlyMakkan period. The suggestion that this verse and those that follow, up to the 16th, oraccording to some only vv. 15 and 16, belong to Madßnah, is entirely without foundation.The statements made in these verses are all prophetical, and such is also the statement ofv. 15, We shall remove the chastisement a little, because the removal of the drought wasfollowed by the “violent seizing”, which brought on the conquest of Makkah. The Ïadßthhas the following reference to it: “When the Prophet invited the Quraish to Islåm, theyrejected him and opposed him; so he prayed, O Allåh, help me against them with sevenyears like the seven years of Joseph. So famine and distress overtook them and all theirresources were exhausted, until they ate dead bodies, and a man used to look to heaven,and he saw between him and it something like smoke on account of hard affliction” (B. 65:xliv, 4).

16a. The prophecy here seems to refer to the constant defeats in battle that were to besuffered by the Quraish, beginning with the battle of Badr, and resulting in the final overthrow of their power by the seizure of Makkah. Ibn Mas‘∂d says that by violent seizing ismeant the day of Badr (B. 65: xliv, 4). The discomfiture of the power of the Quraish beganwith Badr, and that power was utterly broken with the conquest of Makkah.

18a. Moses wanted the Israelites to be allowed to leave Egypt.

24a. Rahw has several significances. It means an intervening space between twothings (T), the sea or the river in this case being an intervening space between theIsraelites and the Egyptians. It also means calm (T), it being implied that there was nostorm in the sea when it was left by the Israelites, so that the Egyptians, finding it calmand motionless, followed the Israelites. Or rahw may signify moving along easily, referring to the Israelites going along without fear of being overtaken.

29a. The weeping for a dead man signifies the remembering of his good qualities oractions, which often bring tears to the eyes. The heaven and the earth wept not for thembecause they had neither the love of God in their hearts, nor had they done anything forthe good of men, so that their good qualities should have been remembered either inheaven or on earth.

37a. Tubba‘ is the surname of the kings of Yaman, but the name Tubba‘ was givenonly to those kings of Yaman who were rulers of Saba’ and Ïa˙ramaut and the Ïimyar(LA). Generally Tubba‘ is taken to be the title of the kings of the Ïimyar. RM quotesI‘Ab as saying that the particular Tubba‘ spoken of here was a prophet. It is generallybelieved that he was a believer in God, while his people were disbelievers.

43a. See 37:62a.

49a. Those who considered themselves mighty and honourable in the land and triedtheir utmost to exterminate the Truth were ultimately brought low in the land in thisvery life and thus tasted the consequences of their arrogance.

54a. See 52:20a.
